sen.j: 平 業盛（たいら の なりもり、嘉応元年（1169年）? - 寿永3年2月7日 (旧暦)（1184年3月20日））は、平教盛の三男。
sen.e: TAIRA no Narimori (around 1169 - March 20, 1184) was the third son of TAIRA no Norimori.
TAIRA no Narimori (around 1169 - March 20, 1184) was the third son of TAIRA no Norimori.
TAIRA no Narimori (around 1169 - March 20, 1184) was the third son of TAIRA no Norimori.

sen.j: 兄弟に平通盛、平教経、忠快らがある。
sen.e: His brothers were TAIRA no Michimori, TAIRA no Noritsune, Chukai and others.
His brothers included TAIRA no Michimori, TAIRA no Noritsune and a priest Chukai.
sen.cmt: わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: His brothers included TAIRA no Michimori, TAIRA no Noritsune and a priest Chukai.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下蔵人。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and kurodo (imperial archives keeper).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and kurodo (imperial archives keeper).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and kurodo (imperial archives keeper).

sen.j: 父の教盛は平清盛の弟であり、業盛も平氏政権の全盛の中で若くして任官し栄達した。
sen.e: His father Norimori was a younger brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori, and in the golden years of the Taira clan government, Narimori was also appointed as a court official and achieved advancement in rank at a young age.

Taking advantage of his family background that his father Norimori was a younger brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori, he succeeded in life by being appointed as a court official despite his young age amid the golden age of the Taira clan government.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Taking advantage of his family background that his father Norimori was a younger brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori, he succeeded in life by being appointed as a court official despite his young age amid the golden age of the Taira clan government.

sen.j: しかし寿永2年（1183年）7月、源義仲に追われ平家一門が都落ちすると、業盛も父や兄らともにこれに従った。
sen.e: But in 1183, when the Taira family was thrown out of power by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka and fled from the capital, Narimori, his father and his brothers and others followed the family.
However, when the Taira family was driven from the capital by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka in July 1183, Narimori accompanied them with his father and older brothers.
sen.cmt: 「7月」が訳漏れです。原文と少々意味が異なるので書き換えました。「兄ら」なのでolderを加えました。
sen.e: However, when the Taira family was driven from the capital by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka in July 1183, Narimori accompanied them with his father and older brothers.

sen.j: 寿永3年（1184年）2月7日、一ノ谷の戦いにおいて、兄たちとともに山手の城戸口の防備にあたったが、源範頼の軍の手にかかり戦死。
sen.e: At the Battle of Ichinotani, Norimori and his brothers were tasked with defending the doorway of the castle on the mountainside, but Norimori was killed by the army led by MINAMOTO no Noriyori on February 7, 1184.
Narimori, who was defending the camp established near mountains with his older brothers, was killed by the army commanded by MINAMOTO no Noriyori on February 7, 1184 in the Battle of Ichinotani.
sen.cmt: わかりづらいので書き換えました。「兄たち」なのでolderを加えました。訳中の教盛は業盛の間違いと思われます。「山手の城戸口」は陣の一つと考えられるので書き換えました。
sen.e: Narimori, who was defending the camp established near mountains with his older brothers, was killed by the army commanded by MINAMOTO no Noriyori on February 7, 1184 in the Battle of Ichinotani.

sen.j: 『平家物語』によると、業盛は常陸国の住人・土屋重行と組んで討たれたとされている。
sen.e: According to "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike), Narimori teamed up with a inhabitant of Hitachi Province named Shigeyuki TSUCHIYA in this battle but came to a bad end.
According to "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike), Narimori was killed by Shigeyuki TSUCHIYA, an inhabitant of Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 「土屋重行と組んで討たれた」は「土屋重行と戦い，討たれた」と考えます。冠詞をanに訂正しました。
sen.e: According to "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike), Narimori was killed by Shigeyuki TSUCHIYA, an inhabitant of Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 『源平盛衰記』にはその最期の様子が、以下の通りより詳しく描かれている。
sen.e: Narimori's death is described in greater detail in "Genpei Seisuiki" (The Rise and Decline of the Minamoto and Taira clans).
"Genpei Seisuiki" (The Rise and Decline of the Minamoto and Taira clans) describes the Narimori's death in further detail as follows.
sen.cmt: 「以下の通り」が訳漏れです。わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: "Genpei Seisuiki" (The Rise and Decline of the Minamoto and Taira clans) describes the Narimori's death in further detail as follows.

sen.j: 即ち、源義経の逆落としの奇襲によって大混乱に陥った平家軍は海上の船団に向かって敗走しはじめた。
sen.e: That is, a surprise attack by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune plunged the Taira's army into chaos and they started riding out toward their fleet on the sea.
The Taira's army, which was plunged into chaos by a surprise attack called "Hiyodorigoe no sakaotoshi" that was commanded by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, started fleeing to their fleet waiting on the sea.
sen.cmt: わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: The Taira's army, which was plunged into chaos by a surprise attack called "Hiyodorigoe no sakaotoshi" that was commanded by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, started fleeing to their fleet waiting on the sea.

sen.j: 業盛は馬上、渚に佇んでいたところを泥屋四郎吉安に組みかかられた。
sen.e: When Narimori drew rein by the sea shore, he was attacked by Shiro-Yoshiyasu DOROYA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Narimori lingered on the seashore on horseback, Shiro-Yoshiyasu DOROYA pounced on him.
sen.cmt: 原文のイメージがわくように書き換えました。
sen.e: When Narimori lingered on the seashore on horseback, Shiro-Yoshiyasu DOROYA pounced on him.

sen.j: 双方馬から落ちて上になり、下になりながら組み合った。
sen.e: Both were thrown off their horses, scuffled with each other and rolled along on the ground until they fell into an old well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After being thrown off their horses, both of them scuffled with each other, rolling over and over.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After being thrown off their horses, both of them scuffled with each other, rolling over and over.

sen.j: そのうちに古井戸に落ちてしまった。
sen.e: In the end, they fell into an old well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the end, they fell into an old well.

sen.j: 業盛が上になって四郎の首を搔こうとするが、そこへ泥屋五郎が助けに現れて、業盛に兜に取りついた。
sen.e: Narimori sat astride Shiro and was just about to cut off his head with a sword when Goro DOROYA turned up to help Shiro and clutched at Narimori's kabuto (helmet).
When Narimori sat astride Shiro and tried to cut off his head, Goro DOROYA who came to help Shiro threw his arms around Narimori's kabuto (helmet).
sen.cmt: 「兜に取りついた」はclutchでは弱いと考え書き換えました。
sen.e: When Narimori sat astride Shiro and tried to cut off his head, Goro DOROYA who came to help Shiro threw his arms around Narimori's kabuto (helmet).

sen.j: 業盛は振りほどこうとして、五郎は兜をつかんだまま投げ飛ばされた。
sen.e: Narimori wrested away from Goro's grasp and threw Goro who held Narimori's kabuto in his hands.
Trying to wrench himself from Goro, Narimori flung Goro away with his kabuto.
sen.cmt: 原文のイメージがわくように書き換えました。
sen.e: Trying to wrench himself from Goro, Narimori flung Goro away with his kabuto.

sen.j: だが、業盛は手負いになっていた。
sen.e: But because Narimori was wounded, Goro got up and killed him before pulling Shiro up from the old well.
However, Narimori had already been wounded.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, Narimori had already been wounded.

sen.j: 五郎は起き上がると業盛の首を取り、兄を井戸から引き上げた。
sen.e: Goro got up and killed Narimori, and then pulled his older brother up from the old well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Goro got up and killed Narimori, and then pulled his older brother up from the old well.

sen.j: このとき業盛は17歳で、その力の強さに人々は感心したという。
sen.e: It is said that people were impressed with the strength of Narimori who was then just 17 years old.
It is said that the physical strength of Narimori at the young age of seventeen impressed people.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: It is said that the physical strength of Narimori at the young age of seventeen impressed people.

sen.j: 『吾妻鏡』によると、この戦いで、兄の通盛、教経も討ち死にしている。
sen.e: According to "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), Narimori's brothers Michimori and Noritsune were also killed in this battle.
According to "Azuma Kagami" (a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura Bakufu), Narimori's older brothers Michimori and Noritsune were also killed in this battle.
sen.cmt: 吾妻鏡の説明が不適当と思われます。用語サイトを参考に書き換えました。「兄の」なのでolderを加えました。
sen.e: According to "Azuma Kagami" (a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura Bakufu), Narimori's older brothers Michimori and Noritsune were also killed in this battle.

sen.j: このうち教経については『玉葉』などに生存説があった。
sen.e: As for Noritsune, he survived the battle in "Gyokuyo" (Diary of Kanezane KUJO) and so on, and afterwards he played an important role in The Battles of Yashima and Dannoura in gunki monogatari (martial tales) including "Heike Monogatari" and "Genpei Seisuiki".
As for Noritsune, there is a theory that he survived the battle, which is introduced in "Gyokuyo" (Diary of Kanezane KUJO) and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。原文と訳文の意味が異なります。
sen.e: As for Noritsune, there is a theory that he survived the battle, which is introduced in "Gyokuyo" (Diary of Kanezane KUJO) and so on.

sen.j: 『平家物語』『源平盛衰記』などの軍記物語ではこの後の屋島の戦い、壇ノ浦の戦いで大いに活躍している。
sen.e: According to martial tales such as "Heike Monogatari" and "Genpei Seisuiki," Noritsune participated actively in subsequent battles, The Battles of Yashima and The Battle of Dannoura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。原文と訳文の意味が異なります。
sen.e: According to martial tales such as "Heike Monogatari" and "Genpei Seisuiki," Noritsune participated actively in subsequent battles, The Battles of Yashima and The Battle of Dannoura.

sen.j: 2月13日、一ノ谷の戦いで討たれた他の平家一門の首とともに京都で獄門に処された。
sen.e: On February 13, heads of Narimori and other members of the Taira family who ware killed in the Battle of Ichinotani ware exposed at a prison gate in Kyoto.
On February 13, the head of Narimori was exposed in Kyoto with other heads of the Taira clan killed in the Battle of Ichinotani.
sen.cmt: 「獄門に処す」は和英辞書では訳のようになっていますが，わかりづらいので単に「さらす」にしました。
sen.e: On February 13, the head of Narimori was exposed in Kyoto with other heads of the Taira clan killed in the Battle of Ichinotani.
